definition: to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
to stick/to paste/to post (e.g. on a blog)/to keep close to/to fit snugly/to subsidize/allowance (e.g. money for food or housing)/sticker/classifier for sticking plaster: strip

sentences.english: The Japanese handbill poster notices and the ukiyoe have very deep origin and so on.
sentences.chinese: 日本招贴与浮世绘有着很深的渊源等等。

sentences.english: Get some artwork or a poster to make your wall a little more visually interesting.
sentences.chinese: 放一些艺术品或招贴画到墙上使它看起来更有趣一点。

sentences.english: Stores should display posters showing pottery that is designed to appeal to college-age individuals.
sentences.chinese: 商店应该张贴能够吸引在校年龄人群的陶器的招贴画。

sentences.english: But the format design performance is more prominent in the handbill poster notice design.
sentences.chinese: 而在招贴设计中版式设计表现的更为突出。

sentences.english: We had nothing to do except (to) look at the posters outside the cinema.
sentences.chinese: 我们无事可做，只有看看电影院外面的招贴。

sentences.english: The coloured posters allured the children into the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 彩色招贴吸引孩子们去看戏。

sentences.english: That quack doctor for the clap used to be stuck up in all the greenhouses.
sentences.chinese: 每一应公用厕所都有治淋病的庸医的招贴。

sentences.english: In big cities you can see many eye-catchIng posters.
sentences.chinese: 在大城市，你会看到许多触目的招贴广告。

sentences.english: One of my favorite posters says, “ Life is a test.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢的一幅招贴画上面写有，“生活是个测验。

sentences.english: Poster with lupine as the "intelligent" interpretation of start writing.
sentences.chinese: 招贴以羽扇为“智慧”的诠释展开创作。

definition: to hang up (a picture, banner, mosquito net etc)
